title: The extent to which circular economy principles have been applied in the design of medical devices for low-resource ... - Frontiers
summary: This article highlights the issue of non-functional and obsolete medical devices in low-resource settings in Sub-Saharan Africa and proposes leveraging circular economy principles to address it. The study analyzes 29 scientific papers to identify the use of circular principles, such as durability, maintenance, repair, and upgrade. The findings indicate that while these principles are being considered in the design of medical devices for longevity, aspects related to recovery and recycling are not getting enough attention.

title: PakTech and Braukon bring first automated handle applicator of its kind to Europe - Food and Drink Technology
summary: BrauKon, a brewery systems supplier and manufacturer, has started operating PakTech's automated handle applicator equipment for the first time in Europe. The collaboration will allow BrauKon to offer a full range of services for contract brewing. BrauKon will use the handle applicator to apply PakTech handles on its new line of Camba cans, which are made from 100% recycled plastic.

title: 10 New Technology Trends in 2023: Key Tech to Watch - EarthWeb
summary: This article discusses 10 new technology trends for 2023, including artificial intelligence, genomics, the metaverse, quantum computing, datafication, blockchain, green technology, robotic process automation, hyperautomation, and digitally immune systems. These trends are expected to have a significant impact on businesses and society in the coming years.
